triples.name: Behavioral ecology
triples.relevance: Core field that the paper surveys, studying evolutionary basis of animal behavior due to ecological pressures.

triples.name: Animal behavior
triples.relevance: Fundamental subject of the spatial-social interface integrating how animals behave in space and social contexts.

triples.name: Social behavior
triples.relevance: One of the two core dimensions (along with spatial behavior) at the spatial-social interface.

triples.name: Spatial cognition
triples.relevance: Relates to how organisms perceive and navigate space, central to understanding spatial behavior.

triples.name: Transmission (medicine)
triples.relevance: Pathogen transmission is explicitly mentioned as a consequence of spatial-social interactions affecting disease dynamics.

triples.name: Population dynamics
triples.relevance: Explicitly mentioned as an ecological process affected by spatial-social interface behavior.

triples.name: Graph theory
triples.relevance: Key approach for integrating spatial and social processes, useful for modeling networks of individuals.

triples.name: Habitat-selection hypothesis
triples.relevance: Related to density-dependent habitat selection, a key mechanism linking spatial distribution with social factors.

triples.name: Ecological niche
triples.relevance: Niche specialization is explicitly mentioned as a key concept integrating social and spatial processes.

triples.name: Animal migration
triples.relevance: Fundamental to movement ecology which the paper identifies as linking the spatial-social interface.
